newsitem.title: USA: Gaylord sees weakness in tourism, TV outlet.
newsitem.headline: Gaylord sees weakness in tourism, TV outlet.

text.p: Gaylord Entertainment Corp said Tuesday that it expected its 1996 results to be hurt by sluggish performances by its Nashville tourism properties and its Seattle television station.
The company said it was seeking a buyer for the Seattle station, KSTW, which has not met financial expectations.
Gaylord said it expected 1996 cash flow to increase by between 10 percent and 12 percent compared with the previous year, excluding operations at KHTV, a Houston television station.
The station was sold earlier this year to Tribune Co for $95 million plus an additional $6.6 million in working capital.
